alert.note: Alert for Big Island Interior; Haleakala Summit; Kohala; Kona; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 18 at 3:32PM HST until February 18 at 7:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL MAINTAINS A FLOOD THREAT ACROSS THE EASTERN ISLANDS... ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall on saturated soil continues to be possible. * WHERE...The island of Maui and the Big Island. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Significant flooding may occur due to the overflow of streams and drainages. Roads in several areas may be closed, along with property damage in urban or low lying spots due to runoff. Landslides may also occur in areas with steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Continued moderate to heavy rainfall across saturated soil will maintain a flood threat for Maui and the Big Island through Sunday afternoon. Enhanced rainfall is also possible across the remaining islands, but the flood threat has receded there.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. A Flood Watch means that conditions are favorable for flash flooding. Flash Flooding is LIFE THREATENING. Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle or on foot.

area.areaDesc: Big Island Interior; Haleakala Summit; Kohala; Kona; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West
